explanation: Agent A's scenario is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 directs that pointers should point to const-qualified types whenever possible (i.e. when the pointee is not modified). In the shown code MHD_quiesce_daemon passes the string literal "q" to MHD_itc_activate_. If MHD_itc_activate_ is declared to take a non-const char * (e.g. int MHD_itc_activate_(..., char *msg)), then the declaration (and thus the interface) fails to const-qualify a pointer that should be const — which is what Rule 8.13 forbids. If, instead, MHD_itc_activate_ is declared to take a const char * (or equivalent const-qualified type), there is no Rule 8.13 violation. Note also that the actual violation would be in the (missing) declaration/definition of MHD_itc_activate_, not in the call site shown; the call site only exhibits the condition that reveals the mis-qualified declaration.
